intro: Hieracium didymanthum, commonly known as the two-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of leaves and flowering stems with yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Hieracium didymanthum is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
